alert.note: Alert for Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 1:14PM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 18 inches possible. * WHERE...Snowy and Judith Mountains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
